intro: Eupatorium celtidifolium, commonly known as white snakeroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, wooded areas and can grow up to 2 meters in height. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a noxious weed in some regions.
